dc_description_s: The University of Michigan Matthaei Botanical Gardens and Nichols Arboretum received funding for assessing the natural plant communities growing on its four properties, for a project titled Assessing Globally-Ranked At-Risk Native Plant Communities: A General Conservation Survey of High Quality Natural Areas of the University of Michigan Matthaei Botanical Gardens and Nichols Arboretum. This was a critically urgent project as there are 16 distinct natural plant communities on the properties, the majority of which are at-risk around the world, in the nation, and in the State of Michigan. Managing these natural communities for long-term conservation helps protect our nation's rich natural heritage for this and future generations.
dc_title_s: Natural Plant Communities: University of Michigan
